pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.13: Suṭṭhu, devāti, literally, “It is good, sir.” The exact contextual meaning is not clear to me.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.1: For the rendering of antepura as “royal compound”, see the Appendix of Technical Terms.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.26: This may refer to illegitimate offspring, and the monk acting as an informant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.56.1: The Pali just says threshold: “The threshold of a consecrated king”. To give the rule a more definitive meaning, I have added “bedroom” from the word commentary below.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.6: Pitāmashayuga refers to “grandfather generation”, thus a total of eight generations back.
